Hi,
I have weired problem using java.beans.XMLDecoder in combination with 
the junit/runner/excluded.properties patch , which is necessary to 
avoid the "ClassNotFoundException"-problem with log4J.

After patching  excluded.properties the "ClassNotFoundException"-
problem with log4J disapeared but instead i got a new problem in my 
own source. this problem only occured if i run my source with junit.

(it does not occure, if i run it with eclipes junit runner or if i 
run the source from its main() without junit.)

the code lookes like this:
+++++++++
  dec =
      new java.beans.XMLDecoder( 
        new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(file)));
	  if (dec == null) throw new UserAgentException("cound not 
instanciate XMLdecoder with filename: "+filename);
    Object readObj = dec.readObject();

    // the next 7 lines are for debugging purposes    
    Class oc = readObj.getClass();
    ClassLoader cl1 = oc.getClassLoader();
    userAgent = new UserAgentImpl();
    ClassLoader cl2 = userAgent.getClass().getClassLoader();
    System.out.println(cl1.toString() + "   "+ cl2.toString() 
       + "\n" + userAgent.getClass().getName()
       + "\n" + readObj.getClass().getName());
    // this line does not work althought the readObj.class is 
    // the same as for userAgent
    // the line throws a ClassCastException 
    userAgent = (UserAgentImpl) readObj;
       
+++++++
the output looks like this:

only if i run the test from a main() class in the TestCase i got
